clinical_study.brief_title: Salsalate in Patients Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b, 12-Month, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Preliminary Efficacy of Salsalate in Patients With Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to test the safety and tolerability of twice daily Salsalate in patients with mild to moderate Alzheimer's Disease. Half of the participants will receive Salsalate and half will receive placebo during the 1-year duration of the study.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Phase 1b, 12-month, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and preliminary efficacy of salsalate in patients with mild to moderate AD. Approximately 40 subjects will be randomized 1:1 to placebo or active. All study drugs will be administered orally bid [two placebo tablets bid or two 750 mg salsalate tablets bid (for a total daily dose of 3,000 mg)] for 12 months.
This study will test the effects of Salsalate on cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) proteins, brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and cognitive (thinking and memory) tests in subjects with mild to moderate AD. This study uses placebo which looks like the experimental drug but does not have any active drug in it.

study_design_info.masking_description: Double-Blind study. Only investigational pharmacist will be unblinded.

primary_outcome.description: Assess adverse events during 12 months administration of Salsalate or Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Pharmacokinetic properties of Salsalate in Plasma and Cerebrospinal Fluid
secondary_outcome.description: Measure steady-state plasma and cerebrosinal fluid concentrations of salsalate and its metabolites.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Pharmacodynamic properties of Salsalate in Cerebrospinal Fluid
secondary_outcome.description: Measure CSF concentrations of total tau, phosphorylated tau, and neurofilament light chain

other_outcome.measure: Change in brain volume on brain MRI
other_outcome.description: Measure of global and regional volumes of interest (such as hippocampus)

other_outcome.measure: Change in structural and functional connectivity on brain MRI
other_outcome.description: Connectivity between brain regions measured using diffusion tensor MRI and resting state functional MRI

other_outcome.measure: Change in Cerebrospinal Fluid Biomarkers of phosphorylated tau
other_outcome.description: Measure CSF concentrations of phosphorylated tau protein (p-tau) pg/mL

other_outcome.measure: Change in Cerebrospinal Fluid Biomarkers of neurofilament light chain
other_outcome.description: Measure CSF concentrations of neurofilament light chain protein (NfL) pg/ml

other_outcome.measure: Change in Cerebrospinal Fluid Biomarkers of total tau
other_outcome.description: Measure CSF concentrations of total tau protein (t-tau) pg/mL

other_outcome.measure: Change in Cerebrospinal Fluid Biomarkers of beta amyloid 1-42
other_outcome.description: Measure CSF concentrations of beta amyloid protein (Abeta1-42) pg/mL

other_outcome.measure: Change in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-cognitive scale
other_outcome.description: Measure changes using the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-cognitive (ADAS-cog) which evaluates cognitive dysfunctions

other_outcome.measure: Change in Mini Mental State Examination
other_outcome.description: Measure changes using the Mini Mental State Exam (MMSE) which evaluates cognitive function.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Alzheimer's disease Clinical Activities of Daily Living Scale
other_outcome.description: Measure changes in function, and in particular the degree of disability using the Alzheimer's disease Clinical Activities of Daily Living scale (ADCS-ADL)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (CDR-SB)
other_outcome.description: Measure change in dementia status using the Clinical Dementia Rating scale (CDR-SB)

arm_group.description: Drug: Salsalate 2 tablets twice daily (3,000 mg total daily) by mouth for 12 months
Drug: Placebo 2 tablets twice daily by mouth for 12 months

intervention.description: Salsalate is a non-acetylated dimer of salicylic acid, and is classified as a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). Salsalate has been commercially available in the US as a prescription drug for the relief of the signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and related rheumatic disorder for decades.
